questions.question: A single axis autopilot system:
options: (a) provides stabilization about the normal axis
(b) provides control about the pitch axis
(c) is unsuitable for use in powered aircraft
(d) provides control about the roll axis
questions.solution: (a) provides stabilization about the normal axis

questions.question: A single axis autopilot may also be called:
An          autopilot:
options: (a) is a system which will maintain a preselected altitude
(b) is a system which will maintain a preselected airspeed
(d) is an outer loop control system
questions.solution: (a) is a system which will maintain a preselected altitude

questions.question: The fundamental components of an autopilot control loop are:
options: (a) rate gyro, servomotor, error signal generator
(c) torque limiter, error signal generator, servomotor
(d) servomotor, rate gyro, torque limiter, error signal generator
questions.solution: (a) rate gyro, servomotor, error signal generator

questions.question: A device in a closed loop control system in which a small power input controls a
An automatic flight control system:
options: (a) is another name for an autopilot system
(b) applies flight data to the autopilot system
(c) is automatically disengaged by a gpws alert
(d) can only be used in EFIS equipped aircraft
questions.solution: (a) is another name for an autopilot system

questions.question: An aircraft has yaw damping included in its auto-stabilization system. An essential
options: (c) automatic maintenance of C of G position

questions.question: Automatic flight systems may be capable of controlling the aircraft flight in:
An automatic flight control system is fitted with control wheel steering (CWS).
options: (a) The autopilot must be disengaged before the pilot can input manoeuvring
(b) Manoeuvring commands may be input by applying normal forces to the
(c) Manoeuvring commands may be input using pitch and turn controls on the
(d) The CWS is only there for steering on the ground
questions.solution: (a) The autopilot must be disengaged before the pilot can input manoeuvring

questions.question: During an approach to an autoland at 1500 feet:
options: (a) off line channels are manually engaged, flare mode is armed
(b) localizer is controlling the roll channel, off line channels are automatically
(c) localizer is controlling the roll channel, stabilizer is trimmed nose up and roll
(d) provided both localizer and glide slope signals are valid LAND 3 will illuminate
questions.solution: (a) off line channels are manually engaged, flare mode is armed

questions.question: What type of autoland system would be required for the landing to continue
Inputs to the rudder channels initially originate from:
options: (b) compass gyro and gyro for ah
(c) compass gyro and turn and slip gyro
(d) AH gyro and turn and slip gyro

questions.question: An automatic flight system which can safely continue with an automatic landing
Altitude Select and Altitude Hold are examples of:
During an autoland the caption LAND 2 is illuminated. The system is:
For an autoland system to meet FAIL-PASSIVE criteria it must:
options: (b) withstand a system failure without excessive deviations from flight path
(c) can continue with an autoland below alert height
(d) can continue with an autoland above alert height

questions.question: During an autoland at 50 ft AGL (45’ GA) the pitch control of the autopilot is
During an autoland approach:
options: (b) localizer roll control is disengaged just prior to touchdown
(c) flare is disengaged prior to touchdown at 5’ GA
(d) glide slope is the engaged pitch mode until 5’ GA

questions.question: In an autoland at 1000’ AGL with two autopilots engaged:
options: (a) the armed roll mode would be LOCALIZER
(b) the engaged roll mode would be GLIDE SLOPE
(c) the engaged pitch mode would be FLARE
(d) the engaged roll mode would be LOCALIZER
questions.solution: (a) the armed roll mode would be LOCALIZER

questions.question: An automatic flight control system in which the application of normal forces on the
If a fault develops in a triplex autopilot system during an approach, the system will
options: (a) fail-passive and the landing may continue
questions.solution: (a) fail-passive and the landing may continue

questions.question: Central Air Data Computers (CADCs) transmit data concerning;-
Inner loop stability is obtained by;-
options: (a) inputs from the Air Data Computer
(d) raw data feed to the data control bus bar
questions.solution: (a) inputs from the Air Data Computer

questions.question: The autothrottle is used to control some factors during the three primary control
The mode that enables the pilot to manoeuvre his aircraft in pitch and roll by use of
options: (a) control wheel steering (CWS) mode that allows the pilot to control the
(b) touch control steering that will permit the pilot to control the aircraft via the
(c) control wheel steering mode which will disengage the servomotors
(d) touch control steering mode which will prevent the flaps retracting
questions.solution: (a) control wheel steering (CWS) mode that allows the pilot to control the

questions.question: Touch control steering:
options: (b) will only operate while the flaps are down
(c) allows the pilot to control the aircraft with the servomotors disengaged
(d) engages the servomotors during manual operation in pitch and roll

questions.question: A system which can still function without degradation of performance after a
During a CAT 2 ILS automatic approach, the source for altitude information is the:
options: (b) radar altimeter which becomes effective below about 2500 feet
(c) radio altimeter which becomes effective below about 2500 feet

questions.question: Heading hold mode relates to control in:
options: (a) the height lock via the CADC
(b) the pitch channel via the inner loop
(c) the roll channel via the outer loop control source
(d) the manometer mode of the CADC
questions.solution: (a) the height lock via the CADC

questions.question: The system which allows the pilot to control the aircraft with the servomotors
The type of automatic landing system which would necessitate a manual landing
After a failure of one of the necessary redundant systems below alert height you
options: (a) continue the descent but revert to a higher DH
(c) disengage autoland and take over manually
questions.solution: (a) continue the descent but revert to a higher DH

questions.question: When localizer and glide slope are captured at 1500 feet during an automatic
options: (a) touchdown mode and roll out mode
(b) flare mode arm and touchdown mode
(c) flare mode engage and roll out mode
(d) flare mode arm and off line channels engaged
questions.solution: (a) touchdown mode and roll out mode

questions.question: A fundamental requirement of a closed loop servomechanism is:
ALT HOLD is an example of:
options: (a) inner loop control in the roll axis
(b) outer loop input to the pitch channel
(c) outer loop control about the longitudinal axis
(d) inner loop control in the pitch axis
questions.solution: (a) inner loop control in the roll axis

questions.question: A rate gyro:
options: (a) has three degrees of freedom, two gimbals and a transducer
(b) senses rate of turn and positions an indicator on the EHSI
(c) supplies rate and displacement information to the computer
questions.solution: (a) has three degrees of freedom, two gimbals and a transducer

questions.question: To prevent servomotor runaway from producing excessive demands to the control
Auto-trim is functional:
options: (a) in the pitch and roll channel with the autopilot engaged
(b) in the pitch channel only with the autopilot engaged
(c) in the pitch channel only with the autopilot disengaged
(d) in the pitch and roll channel with the autopilot disengaged
questions.solution: (a) in the pitch and roll channel with the autopilot engaged

questions.question: L NAV is an............. input to the ..............channel using data from the...........
In an aircraft which requires a Mach trim system it will apply inputs to the
options: (b) at high Mach numbers with the autopilot engaged
(c) at Mach one with the autopilot engaged or not
(d) at high subsonic speeds with the autopilot engaged or not

questions.question: With the autopilot engaged in the Alt mode the Captain alters the barometric
options: (b) changes its altitude in accordance with the change in pressure setting
(c) switches barometric input over to the 1st Pilot setting

questions.question: Control wheel steering enables a pilot to:
options: (a) taxi the aircraft on the ground
(b) manoeuvre the aircraft in the air while the autopilot is engaged
(c) alter the flight path while the autopilot is engaged by applying a breakout
(d) manoeuvre the aircraft with the autopilot disengaged
questions.solution: (a) taxi the aircraft on the ground

questions.question: Autopilot synchronization in an aircraft:
options: (a) requires that the interlocks are made before the autopilot will engage
(b) ensures that, when the autopilot is engaged, the take-over is effected
(c) requires that the aircraft is trimmed out before the autopilot can be engaged
(d) needs at least two alternators running in parallel
questions.solution: (a) requires that the interlocks are made before the autopilot will engage

questions.question: The rules for the use of auto-trim are that it:
options: (a) can be engaged without the autopilot
(b) usually operates on all three axes
(c) is not needed if the autopilot is engaged
(d) operates only in conjunction with the autopilot
questions.solution: (a) can be engaged without the autopilot

questions.question: The JAR OPS requirements for single pilot operation under IFR state that the
options: (d) a two axis autopilot with autothrottle

questions.question: JAR 25 operational requirements for the installation of automatic pilot state that
Consider the following statements regarding flight envelope protection:
The control laws for an autopilot are known as:
An autoland system that, in the event of an autopilot failure, continues to function
The autoland sequence is considered to be complete when:
options: (b) the autopilot is manually disengaged by the pilot
(d) the aircraft reaches the end of the runway

questions.question: The autothrottle will come on automatically even with the A/T switch OFF when:
options: (a) in a FBW aircraft the AoA reaches a critical value called floor
(b) the AoA reaches the stalling angle
(d) reverse thrust is selected in flight
questions.solution: (a) in a FBW aircraft the AoA reaches a critical value called floor

questions.question: An aircraft on autopilot is engaged in the VOR mode and loses the VOR signals as it
options: (b) decouples from the VOR and disconnects
(c) tunes to the next VOR on the route
(d) decouples from the VOR and flies the last heading for a fixed period

questions.question: For an aircraft with a non-synchronized autopilot system, ‘snatching’ of the controls
options: (a) the pilot ensuring that the aircraft is trimmed out before selecting or
(b) being in a straight and level position
questions.solution: (a) the pilot ensuring that the aircraft is trimmed out before selecting or

questions.question: With the autopilot in CWS the pilot manoeuvres the aircraft and releases control.
options: (d) attitude at the time of release

questions.question: Autopilot corrections affecting pitch are carried out by:
For a commercial aircraft operating with a single pilot in IFR the minimum
options: (d) Altitude Hold, Heading mode and Speed
